channel.title: Comments on: Online Video Ads, The Ratios Are All Wrong

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2010/06/18/online-video-ads-the-ratios-are-all-wrong/#comment-3454">Ant</a>.
I don't really mind ads as a concept, but I think there are some boundaries.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Ant.

I don’t really mind ads as a concept, but I think there are some boundaries.

item.title: By: Ant
item.dc:creator: Ant
item.description: Ads are annoying because you have to see same over and over again.
item.content:encoded: Ads are annoying because you have to see same over and over again.

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2010/06/18/online-video-ads-the-ratios-are-all-wrong/#comment-3452">joecr</a>.
For very short content it's hard to do much advertising without taking up a huge percentage of the time. Probably better off focusing on either alternative ad styles, or just longer content.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to joecr.

For very short content it’s hard to do much advertising without taking up a huge percentage of the time. Probably better off focusing on either alternative ad styles, or just longer content.

item.title: By: joecr
item.dc:creator: joecr
item.description: Well that reminds me of the Dilbert & New Yorker animated podcasts from ring tails. More time on commercial then for real content.
item.content:encoded: Well that reminds me of the Dilbert & New Yorker animated podcasts from ring tails. More time on commercial then for real content.
